september.name: Prom 62: Israel Philharmonic Orchestra
september.description: The Israel Philharmonic takes to the stage with its longest-serving maestro and a favourite soloist.

september.name: Prom 63: Liszt & Mahler
september.description: A chance to experience the precision, subtlety and sparkle of an ensemble widely rated as one of the great success stories of the contemporary classical scene.

september.name: Prom 64: Audience Choice
september.description: Create your own Prom! Tonight the audience choose what they would like to hear, selecting from the Budapest Festival Orchestra‘s music library.

september.name: Proms Saturday Matinee 4: Tippett, John Tavener & Gubaidulina
september.description: Music of humanism, of faith and light and some unquiet brooding too.

september.name: Prom 65: Elgar, Berkeley, Rachmaninov & Kodály
Prom 66: Organ recital - Thierry Escaich
september.description: The second of this year’s organ recitals is given by the mercurial organist of St-Étienne-du-Mont in Paris, a composer and improviser of renown making his debut on the Royal Albert Hall’s mighty instrument.

september.name: Prom 67: Beethoven – Missa Solemnis
september.description: A seasoned interpreter revisits one of Beethoven’s supreme achievements, the largest and longest of his non-stage works.

september.name: Proms Chamber Music 8: Christian Tetzlaff & Lars Vogt
september.description: A stellar recital from renowned soloists who are also dedicated chamber music specialists.

september.name: Prom 68: Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra & Hélène Grimaud
september.description: The Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra visits the Proms in the first of two concerts with its current Music Director.

september.name: Prom 69: Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra & Anne-Sophie Mutter
september.description: For the second of its two concerts, the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra preface Mahler’s turbulent and heart-wrenching Fifth Symphony with lyrical music by one of the most distinguished and prolific of contemporary German composers.

september.name: Prom 70: Bridge, Sir Harrison Birtwistle & Holst
september.description: David Robertson’s second programme revels in the diversity of British music.

september.name: Prom 71: Tribute to Stan Kenton
september.description: We salute the artistry and creative ambition of jazz legend Stan Kenton, born 100 years ago.

september.name: Prom 72: Philadelphia Orchestra & Janine Jansen
september.description:
The Proms welcome back the fabulous Philadelphia Orchestra after a five-year gap.
This event has no seats remaining - check for returns closer to the date or Prom on the day for £5.

september.name: Prom 73: Weber arr. Berlioz – Der Freischütz
september.description: Proms favourite Sir John Eliot Gardiner conducts Berlioz’s rarely performed French version of Weber’s Romantic opera.

september.name: Proms in the Park - Hyde Park
september.description: The BBC Proms in the Park experience offers a live open-air concert with high-profile artists and presenters, culminating in a BBC Big Screen link-up to the Royal Albert Hall and a firework finale in the park.So gather together your friends, pack a picnic and get ready for a fabulous night out.

september.name: Prom 74: Last Night of the Proms
september.description: Be part of the biggest musical party of the year!

july.name: Prom 1: First Night of the Proms
july.description: Join us for the First Night of the Proms, a varied taster for the new season, building to one of Janáček’s most visceral and optimistic works, the Glagolitic Mass.

july.name: Prom 2: Rossini – William Tell
july.description: Antonio Pappano returns with the Orchestra and Chorus of the Academy of Santa Cecilia, Rome, for a rare revival of Rossini’s magnum opus about the legendary founding fathers of Switzerland and the hero who shoots an apple from his son’s head.

july.name: Prom 3: Organ recital – Bach, Bingham, Alain & Liszt
july.description: A major new work plus pieces from Alain, Liszt and J.S. Bach in Stephen Farr’s afternoon recital on the fabled organ of the Royal Albert Hall.

july.name: Prom 4: Brian – Symphony No. 1, 'The Gothic'
july.description:
Over a thousand performers gather for a rare performance of Brian’s gargantuan work, ‘The Gothic’.
This event has no seats remaining - check for returns closer to the date or Prom on the day for £5

july.name: Proms Chamber Music 1: Esfahani plays Bach's Goldberg Variations
july.description: The Proms Chamber Music series begins at the top with one of the unassailable peaks of the repertoire.

july.name: Prom 5: Messiaen, Dusapin & Beethoven
july.description: A mainly French affair and a fabulous line-up for Beethoven’s Triple Concerto, which sees the return of iconic Martha Argerich and the debut of brothers Renaud and Gautier Capuçon.

july.name: Prom 6: Weber, Brahms & Stravinsky
july.description: Renaud and Gautier Capuçon play Brahms’s meltingly beautiful Double Concerto and Myung-Whun Chung leads the Orchestre Philharmonique de Radio France for Weber’s Oberon overture and Stravinsky’s famous The Rite of Spring.

july.name: Prom 7: Schubert – String Quintet
july.description: The first of 2011’s Late Night Proms focuses on Schubert’s stirring String Quintet performed by the Valentin Erben and the Belcea Quartet.

july.name: Prom 8: Dvořák & Smetana
july.description: A Czech evening as Jean-Guihen Queyras plays Dvořák’s Cello Concerto and Proms favourite Jiří Bělohlávek leads the BBC Symphony Orchestra in a surprising Proms first as the six symphonic poems of Má vlast are performed complete and in sequence.

july.name: Prom 9: Sibelius, Bartók and Janáček
july.description: Sir Mark Elder and the Hallé are joined by András Schiff in a mixed programme of 20th-century masters

july.name: Prom 10: Debussy, Ravel & Falla
july.description: The BBC Philharmonic’s new Chief Conductor Designate Juanjo Mena brings us images of musical Spain – dancing days, moonlit caresses and sultry nights.

july.name: Prom 11: Human Planet Prom
july.description: Big-screen video projections and excerpts from Nitin Sawhney’s score for the acclaimed landmark BBC One series Human Planet.

july.name: Prom 12: Human Planet Prom
july.description: Big-screen video projections and excerpts from Nitin Sawhney’s score for the acclaimed landmark BBC One series Human Planet.

july.name: Prom 13: Verdi – Requiem
Proms Chamber Music 2: Purcell, Beamish & Brahms
july.description: A potent mix of old and new in which the youthful members of the Elias Quartet, current BBC Radio 3 New Generation Artists, are joined by a young clarinettist Julian Bliss who is already a Proms veteran.

july.name: Prom 14: Mahler – Symphony No. 9
july.description: A powerful goodbye from Mahler and the chance to say farewell to Sir Roger Norrington in his final concerts as Principal Conductor of the Stuttgart Radio Symphony Orchestra.

july.name: Prom 15: Kodály, Bartók & Liszt
july.description: Vladimir Jurowski’s Hungarian-inspired Prom features Liszt’s Faust Symphony and music from his folk-inspired successors.

july.name: Prom 16: Berlioz, Fauré, Dusapin & Stravinsky
july.description: Thierry Fischer and the BBC National Orchestra of Wales perform contrasting French favourites, joined by the Arditti Quartet for the UK premiere of a recent work by Pascal Dusapin. Following this, the main event of the evening Stravinsky’s much-loved, The Firebird.

july.name: Prom 17: World Routes Academy
july.description: The latest graduate of BBC Radio 3’s World Routes Academy young veena virtuoso Hari Sivanesan shares an evening with his mentor Aruna Sairam, widely regarded as the leading South Indian female vocalist of her generation.

july.name: Prom 18: Beethoven, Dalbavie & Carter
july.description: Thierry Fischer and the BBC National Orchestra of Wales play Beethoven’s Symphony No. 1 and No.7, framed by a pair of premiere flute concertos from distinguished flutist Emmanuel Pahud.

july.name: Prom 19: Honegger, Bridge, Berg, Castiglioni & Debussy
july.description: A typically thought-provoking programme from the BBC Symphony Orchestra’s Artist in Association, Oliver Knussen, showcasing pieces rarely heard in the concert hall alongside established 20th-century classics.

july.name: Prom 20: Horrible Histories – Free Family Prom
july.description: Anyone who has split their sides laughing at CBBC’s hit television series Horrible Histories now has the chance to see and hear the cast perform some of the most popular songs from the show in our Free Family Prom. FREE TICkETS available from 8 July online, by phone and in person at the Royal Albert Hall box office.

july.name: Prom 21: Strauss, Walton & Prokofiev
july.description: Andris Nelsons and his Birmingham forces present an evening of high-octane classics.

july.name: Prom 22: Rachmaninov
july.description: A Sunday choral portrait of Rachmaninov, that takes in familiar favourites as well as neglected masterpieces.

august.name: Proms Chamber Music 3: Les Talens Lyriques
august.description: Couperin, Lully, Rameau and Montéclair expertly revived in an intimate conspectus of the French Baroque.

august.name: Prom 23: Beethoven, Saint-Saëns & Liszt
august.description: Saint-Saëns’s ‘Egyptian’ concerto, Liszt’s Romantic epic and Beethoven’s dramatic Fourth Symphony.

august.name: Prom 24: Elgar, Grainger & Strauss
august.description: Tasmin Little, Sir Andrew Davis and the BBC Symphony perform contrasting impressions of Elgar and Grainger and to mark the 50th anniversary of Grainger’s death, his In a Nutshell suite receives a first outing at the Proms.

august.name: Prom 25: Grainger
august.description: Grainger is celebrated in a special Late Night sequence as star Northumbrian smallpiper Kathryn Tickell and friends take a fresh look at the prodigious activities of one of music’s great originals.

august.name: Prom 26: Debussy, Dutilleux & Ravel
august.description: Returning to the Proms for the first time since 1988, cellist Lynn Harrell celebrates the 95th-birthday year of Henri Dutilleux with a performance of one of his best-loved works, plus Donald Runnicles BBC Scottish Symphony Orchestra perform work by Debussy and Ravel’s ever popular Boléro.

august.name: Prom 27: Robin Holloway, Strauss & Brahms
august.description: Donald Runnicles and BBC Scottish Symphony Orchestra open their second Prom this season with a major world premiere from Robin Holloway, plus Strauss’s Four Last Songs and after the interval, Brahms’s Second Symphony.

august.name: Prom 28: The Tallis Scholars
august.description: A moving and evocative Late Night experience as the Tallis Scholars return to celebrate an anniversary composer - Tomás Luis de Victoria.

august.name: Prom 29: Simón Bolívar Symphony Orchestra plays Mahler
august.description:
Music Director of the Los Angeles Philharmonic, Gustavo Dudamel joins his old friends in the Simón Bolívar Symphony Orchestra to tackle a colossus – Mahler’s Symphony No. 2.
This event has no seats remaining - check for returns closer to the date or Prom on the day for £5

august.name: Prom 30: National Youth Orchestra of Great Britain
august.description: DJ Switch joins the National Youth Orchestra of Great Britain to perform Gabriel Prokofiev’s Concerto for Turntables and Orchestra, while BBC Radio 3 New Generation Artist Benjamin Grosvenor takes on Britten's Piano Concerto. After the interval, Prokofiev's ballet music recounts the doomed love of Verona's most romantic couple.

august.name: Prom 31: Nigel Kennedy plays Bach
august.description: Nigel Kennedy returns to the Proms live and unplugged in solo Bach.

august.name: Prom 32: Brahms & Mahler
august.description: Well-loved Brahms from Christian Tetzlaff, one of the 2011 Proms featured artists, plus Mahler's Das klagende Lied.

august.name: Proms Chamber Music 4: Katia Buniatishvili plays Liszt & Prokofiev
august.description: The young Georgian pianist sensation explores the keyboard virtuosity of Liszt and Prokofiev.

august.name: Prom 33: Sibelius, Grieg & Nielsen
august.description: The Royal Stockholm Philharmonic Orchestra return to the Proms to play two contrasting symphonies by Sibelius and Nielsen, while critically acclaimed young pianist, Alice Sara Ott, makes her Proms debut in one of the most popular of all piano concertos - Grieg's Piano Concerto in A minor.

august.name: Prom 34: Bridge, Holt, Dupré & Saint-Saëns
august.description: A concert with roots on both sides of the channel takes in new music and an old favourite by Saint-Saëns guaranteed to raise the roof.

august.name: Prom 35: Liszt, Glière & Rachmaninov
august.description: Young Ukrainian maestro Kirill Karabits and the Bournemouth Symphony Orchestra tackle a mixed programme with Slavic flavour.

august.name: Prom 36: Steve Reich & Ensemble Modern
august.description: Celebrating Steve Reich’s 75th birthday year with a selection of his seminal pieces.

august.name: Prom 37: Bridge, Brahms, Holst & Elgar
august.description: A concert of surprises and classical music’s best-loved enigma, from the BBC Philharmonic's Chief Guest Conductor, the indefatigable Vassily Sinaisky.

august.name: Prom 38: Film Music Prom
august.description:
The BBC Concert Orchestra and its American principal conductor explore the rich legacy of film music from Hollywood and beyond.
This event has no seats remaining - check for returns closer to the date or Prom on the day for £5.

august.name: Prom 39: Spaghetti Western Orchestra
august.description: The inventive Spaghetti Western Orchestra present their own unique take on Western soundtracks and the music of Ennio Morricone - look out for asthma inhalers, cereal packets and other unlikely instruments.

august.name: Proms Saturday Matinee 1: Bennett, Dutilleux & Maconchy
august.description: Sir Richard Rodney Bennett, one of Britain’s most respected and versatile musicians, turned 75 this year and the first of this season’s contemporary music matinees pays tribute to his distinctive creative voice and its French connections.

august.name: Prom 40: Comedy Prom
august.description:
Musician, actor, comedian and rock ’n’ roll superstar Tim Minchin hosts a Proms first – a Comedy Prom.
This event has no seats remaining - check for returns closer to the date or Prom on the day for £5.

august.name: Prom 41: Joby Talbot & Britten
august.description: A recreation of a Britten concert conducted by the composer at the Proms in 1963 with a contemporary twist provided by Joby Talbot.

august.name: Proms Chamber Music 5: Britten & Bridge
august.description: Youthful music from a neglected master and his famous pupil.

august.name: Prom 42: Tchaikovsky – Swan Lake
august.description: Valery Gergiev and the Orchestra of the Mariinsky Theatre perform Tchaikovsky's Swan Lake.

august.name: Prom 43: Copland, Bax, Barber, Bartók & Prokofiev
august.description: Yuja Wang makes her Proms debut as Andrew Litton presents an international programme with strong American connections.

august.name: Prom 44: Shostakovich, Stravinsky & Tchaikovsky
august.description: Esa-Pekka Salonen presents an all-Russian programme with an acclaimed young soloist.

august.name: Prom 45: Thomas Larcher & Bruckner
august.description: New music that brings together friends and partners followed by a 19th-century cathedral in sound.

august.name: Prom 46: Viktoria Mullova & Matthew Barley
august.description: Join Viktoria Mullova, Matthew Barley and friends in a colourful Late Night entertainment of contrasted styles that marries Hungarian folk music and jazz influences.

august.name: Prom 47: Brahms – Symphony No. 3 & Piano Concerto No. 1
august.description:
The Chamber Orchestra of Europe is celebrating its 30th anniversary with two years of Brahms under Bernard Haitink, and brings a pair of concertos and a pair of symphonies to the Proms.
This event has no seats remaining - check for returns closer to the date or Prom on the day for £5.

august.name: Prom 48: Brahms & Schumann
august.description: Angela Hewitt picks up the Brahms thread and launches this Late Night Prom that takes in an unjustly neglected score by Brahms’s mentor, Robert Schumann, before observing the composer through the prism of an admirer, Arnold Schoenberg.

august.name: Proms Saturday Matinee 2: Maxwell Davies, Aperghis & Sir Harrison Birtwistle
august.description: Contrasted scores from modern masters, a BBC commission and a new direction for sacred music.

august.name: Prom 49: Brahms – Piano Concerto No. 2 & Symphony No. 4
august.description: More of Brahms at his greatest from an authoritative team.

august.name: Prom 50: Britten, Colin Matthews & Mozart
august.description: Music championed by or written in memory of the late Richard Hickox, a versatile and much-missed musician.

august.name: Proms Chamber Music 6: Emmanuel Pahud & Eric Le Sage
august.description: A stellar recital from renowned soloists who are also dedicated chamber music specialists.

august.name: Prom 51: Wagner, Liszt, Kevin Volans & Brahms
august.description: More Brahms and Liszt from Jiří Bělohlávek and the BBC Symphony Orchestra, plus a new concerto hot off the press and written for tonight’s soloist, pianist Barry Douglas.

august.name: Prom 52: Prokofiev & Dutilleux
august.description: A welcome return for Leonidas Kavakos with one of Dutilleux’s most luminous scores and a brace of popular Prokofiev from his leading interpreter.

august.name: Prom 53: Stravinsky, Ravel & Tchaikovsky
august.description: A great youth orchestra and a distinguished and much-loved conductor return.

august.name: Prom 54: Marc–André Hamelin plays Liszt
august.description: For Liszt’s bicentenary year, pianistic titan Marc-Andre Hamelin plays a late-night tribute.

august.name: Prom 55: Handel – Rinaldo
august.description: Glyndebourne Festival Opera makes its annual Proms visit with Rinaldo, the latest in the company’s distinguished line of Handel stagings.

august.name: Prom 56: Strauss & Mahler
august.description: Youthful high jinks and a tragic masterpiece of infinite scope.

august.name: Proms Saturday Matinee 3: Hildegard, Britten, Sir Harrison Birtwistle & Stevie Wishart
august.description: An innovative programme inspired by a remarkable figure ahead of her time.

august.name: Prom 57: Anders Hillborg, Mozart & Beethoven
august.description: Distinguished international guests present top-flight Viennese classics and a post-minimalist maverick from Sweden.

august.name: Prom 58: Mendelssohn – Elijah
august.description: Paul McCreesh directs a raft of enthusiastic choirs and a sensational line-up of soloists in Mendelssohn’s magnum opus.

august.name: Proms Chamber Music 7: Yo-Yo Ma & Kathryn Stott
august.description: A lunchtime date with a long-established recital partnership.

august.name: Prom 59: Hooray for Hollywood
august.description:
The Proms goes to the movies with John Wilson and his Orchestra in a celebration of the Golden Age of Hollywood film musicals.
This event has no seats remaining - check for returns closer to the date or Prom on the day for £5

august.name: Prom 60: Mozart & Bruckner
august.description: A Proms debut for a winning combination and a rising piano star.

august.name: Prom 61: Fitkin & Beethoven
august.description:
A new concerto for Yo-Yo Ma and an iconic masterpiece for all time.
This event has no seats remaining - check for returns closer to the date or Prom on the day for £5.
